responses: Hey, Good to see you again!
Hi there, how can I help?
Hi, nice to be talking again.

patterns: How can I refer to you?
responses: I dont care. Make one up.
Whatever you want my name to be.
My name is over there dude..

patterns: What do you think about Liverpool?
responses: Im personally a fan of Everton
I should be working non-stop. If the host isn't dead for some reason.

patterns: How can I get a library card?
Can I get a library card?
Can someone issue me a library card?
How can I get a card for the library?
Can I get a card for the library?
Can someone issue me a card for the library?
I need a card for the library?
responses: You can issue a card by filling in a form. This is done exclusively electronically at the following link - HERE. You can't do it at the library.

patterns: I borrowed a book. When should I return it?
When should I return the book I borrowed?
What's the deadline for returning a book?
Is there a deadline for returning a book?
I rented a book. How long can I keep it?
How long can I keep the book I rented?
I need to check the deadline for my book
What is the deadline for my book
responses: You can check HERE. Not all books are in the electronic system. Some are written on a physical form. The librarian will tell you when you should return them. In most cases, books written on a form are returned after taking the exam.

patterns: I want to talk to your creator
I want to talk to your master
responses: A guy called Grigor. Check his soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/radicitus

patterns: When can I visit the library?
Can I visit the library now?
I need to visit the library
I want to go to the library?
What time does the library work?
responses:
Every weekday: 09:00 - 12:00 and 13:00- 17:00. 
   The lunch break is from 12:00 - 13:00

patterns: How can I contact the librarian?
Can I get the librarian's contact information?
Can I get the librarian's contact?
I need to contact the librarian
Is there a way to contact the librarian?
responses: You can write to the librarian per email. Here sample.email@fdiba.tu-sofia.bg

patterns: How much can I get fined for a book I have not returned?
I missed a deadline for returning a book. How much can I be fined?
Is there a fine for not returning a book?
How much is the fine for not returning a book?
What is the fine for not returning a book?
I could not return a book in time. Is there a fine?
responses: The fine is 0,1 bgn per day over the deadline.

patterns: I need to contact the IT team
How can I contact the IT team?
Where can I talk to the IT team?
Can I have the IT team's contact information?
Can I get help from IT?
responses:
For Information and inquiries: sample.email@fdiba.tu-sofia.bg 
 For Technical support and service requests: servicedesk@fdiba.tu-sofia.bg

patterns: When does the IT team work?
When can I visit the IT?
Can I visit the IT team now?
I need to visit the IT team
I want to go to the IT team?
What time does the IT office work?
When is the IT office open?
I do not know my username
I do not remember my username
responses: Your username is your faculty number / FDIBA ID

patterns: I am a new student. How do I login?
I just registered at this university. How do I login?
Im a new student. What are my credentials
I just registered at this university. What are my credentials?
I am new. What is my password?
I just registered at this university. What is my password?
responses:
The initial password is written in an attached sheet on the first page of the student's book. It must be replaced the first time you log in! Please don't forget your password, you will need it all the time! 
 Minimum number of symbols = 6 
 Permissible number of incorrect login attempts with an FDIBA ID (within 15 minutes): 7 
 Account is locked when the maximum number of wrong attempts is reached: in 15 minutes

patterns: I locked myself out of my account
I can not login in my account
I can't login in my account
I do not know my password
I can not remember my password
I do not know my password
responses: That is unfortunate. Please contact the IT team and be more careful next time. :)
